definition: to tell in detail
thin or slender/finely particulate/thin and soft/fine/delicate/trifling/(of a sound) quiet/frugal
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

sentences.english: Here I need to put a long series of ellipsis so I account for no details.
sentences.chinese: 後來就是一長串的省略號，就不細說了。

sentences.english: You said you work for Freedom and Fashion. Could you tell us about it in detail?
sentences.chinese: 你說你在“自由與時尚”工作。能跟我們詳細說說嗎？

sentences.english: Because the task of confidentiality, liu town cant elaborate.
sentences.chinese: 因爲任務的保密原則，柳時鎮無法細說。

sentences.english: Given an audience with President Lincoln, he discoursed at length on the high and ancient nobility of his distinguished family.
sentences.chinese: 他不厭其煩細說自己家世顯赫，自古就是高門貴族。

sentences.english: To get at the truth, let's break downhow you use your body to talk.
sentences.chinese: 爲了得到真相，讓我們把身體語言掰開揉碎細細說。

sentences.english: Please tell how do you use the toaster in details?
sentences.chinese: 詳細說一下你是怎樣使用多士爐的？

sentences.english: He added that Sanad might have "foreign links, " without elaborating.
sentences.chinese: 他還說薩那德可能有“國外網絡連接”，但並未細說。

sentences.english: Mind not elaborate, aesthetic long will be tired, change is in the affirmative.
sentences.chinese: 心思不用細說，審美久了都邑委靡，換口味是肯定的。

previously/formerly/once upon a time

pertaining to/concerning/with regard to/about/a matter of
